info.name: Because Future API - V1
info.description:
API collection for Because Future backend - Version 1

Uses Gemini (Nano Banana) API for background removal and try-on processing
Local file storage in /images directory
Custom form-based authentication with JWT
Wardrobe management with platform and user-created category sections

response.name: Success
Success
Success
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Profile updated successfully",
    "data": {
        "userid": "f3a6ad94",
        "email": "user@example.com",
        "first_name": "John Updated",
        "last_name": "Doe Updated",
        "gender": "male",
        "birthday": "1990-01-15",
        "street": "456 Oak Ave",
        "city": "Los Angeles",
        "is_active": true
    }
}

formdata.description: Avatar image file. Authenticated user is inferred from JWT; no user_id field is required.

request.description: Save avatar for the authenticated user. Background is removed using Gemini-1.5-pro and only the person image is stored. Requires Bearer JWT; do not pass user_id.
Get authenticated user's avatar URL. Returns absolute URL ready for frontend use: {"success": true, "data": {"avatar_url": "http://localhost:8000/images/avatars/{user_id}/{filename}.png"}}
Update avatar with base64 encoded image. The avatar_data should be a base64 string (with or without data URL prefix).
Scrape product information from URL. Results are cached for 3 days to save Scrape.do credits. Set force_refresh=true to bypass cache and force re-scraping.

request.description: Force refresh product data by re-scraping (bypasses cache). Always fetches fresh data regardless of cache status. Useful when user suspects data is outdated.

request.description: Extract images from product URL. Example Zara URL: https://www.zara.com/us/en/product/12345

response.name: No Images Found

request.description: Check if a garment size fits based on user measurements. Requires authenticated user with body measurements.

response.name: Success - Fits
Success - Doesn't Fit
Success

request.description: Intelligent fit analysis using Gemini AI. Simply provide wardrobe_item_id (or garment_url for external products) and optional size. Backend automatically fetches user measurements, garment details, and size chart from database. Returns fit percentage, fit level, warnings, and detailed analysis for multiple sizes. Uses prompt engineering for comprehensive fit prediction.

response.name: Success - Risky Fit
Success - Good Fit
Wardrobe Item Not Found
Size Chart Not Available

item.name: Create Try-On Job (with item_urls + optional selfie)

formdata.description: Optional: person image file. If omitted, backend will use the authenticated user's saved avatar from /api/save-avatar.
JSON array of product URLs. Example: ["https://www.zara.com/us/en/product/12345"]
Optional: JSON object with garment_index and garment_details, e.g. {"garment_index":0,"garment_details":{"brand":"Zara"}}

request.description: Create try-on job using product URLs. Backend will scrape product pages (Zara, etc.), extract images and garment details, and call Gemini-1.5-pro. If selfie/person_image is not provided, the user's saved avatar is used.

item.name: Create Try-On Job (with wardrobe_item_id + optional selfie)

formdata.description: Optional: person image file. If omitted, backend will use the authenticated user's saved avatar from /api/save-avatar.
ID of wardrobe item from /api/wardrobe/items. Backend will load the image and garment details (brand, color, category, etc.) automatically.

request.description: Create try-on job using wardrobe item ID. Most efficient method - uses already stored images and metadata. Backend automatically loads the garment image from storage and extracts garment details (brand, color, category, fabric, etc.) from the wardrobe item. If selfie/person_image is not provided, backend uses the authenticated user's saved avatar.

response.name: Wardrobe Item Not Found
Job Failed
Not Ready

formdata.description: Optional: person image file. If omitted, backend uses the authenticated user's saved avatar.

request.description: Multi-garment try-on (top + bottom). Uses Gemini-1.5-pro. If person_image is not provided, backend uses the authenticated user's saved avatar.

request.description: Create a custom category section. Users can create sections beyond the 4 platform sections (upper_body, lower_body, accessoires, wishlist).

response.name: Success

request.description: Create a custom category. category_section must be one of: upper_body, lower_body, accessoires, wishlist (or a user-created section name).
Get available fabric types and care instructions for wardrobe item forms. Returns lists that frontend can use to populate dropdowns.

response.name: Success
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "fabric_types": [
            {"name": "cotton", "display_name": "Cotton"},

            {"id": "do_not_steam", "label": "Do not steam", "icon": "steam", "category": "ironing"},

formdata.description: Optional: ID of custom category (get from GET /api/wardrobe/categories)
Size (e.g., S, M, L, XL, 42, etc.)

formdata.value: Comfortable 100% cotton t-shirt. Perfect for casual wear.

formdata.description: JSON array: [{"name": "cotton", "percentage": 100}]. Percentages must sum to 100.

formdata.value: Machine wash at 30C, Do not bleach, Tumble dry low, Do not iron

  "garment_url": "https://www.zara.com/us/en/product/12345",
  "category_section": "upper_body",
  "category_id": 1,
  "title": "Basic Cotton T-Shirt",
  "brand": "Zara",
  "color": "Navy Blue",

  "care_instructions": "Machine wash at 30C, Do not bleach, Tumble dry low",
  "size": "M",
  "description": "Comfortable 100% cotton t-shirt from Zara. Perfect for everyday wear."
}

request.description: Add garment to wardrobe by extracting from Zara URL. Backend will automatically scrape product page and extract images.

request.description: Update wardrobe item. All fields are optional - only include fields you want to update.

request.description: Extract garment information and images from URL without adding to wardrobe. Uses brand-specific extractors (Zara, etc.). Returns product info, images, and auto-categorization.
